reg.title: Pool Exemption Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 185/2008, June 27, 2008]

section.sectiontext: In this regulation, pool regulation means B.C. Reg. 289/72, the Swimming Pool, Spray Pool and Wading Pool Regulation.
The swimming facility in Dawson Creek known as "Rotary Lake" is exempt from the pool regulation.
The swimming facility near Pemberton known as "Meager Creek Hotsprings Pools" is exempt from the pool regulation.
The swimming facility in Nakusp known as "Nakusp Hotspring Pool" is exempt from the following provisions of the pool regulation:

paragraph.paragraphtext: all requirements respecting elevated lifeguard stands in section 69;

section.sectiontext: The swimming facility in Ainsworth Hot Springs known as "Ainsworth Hotspring Pool" is exempt from the following provisions of the pool regulation:

paragraph.paragraphtext: all requirements respecting elevated lifeguard stands in section 69;

section.marginalnote: Upper Level Pools â€” Halcyon Hot Springs
section.sectiontext: The 3 upper level pools at the swimming facility near Nakusp know as Halcyon Hot Springs are exempt from the following provisions of the pool regulation:

paragraph.paragraphtext: all requirements respecting elevated lifeguard stands in section 69;

section.sectiontext: The swimming facility in Whistler known as "H2Air Water Ramp" is exempt from the pool regulation.

section.marginalnote: Yellow Point Lodge Salt Water Pool
section.sectiontext: The swimming facility in Ladysmith known as "Yellow Point Lodge Salt Water Pool" is exempt from the pool regulation.
The swimming facility in Ladysmith known as "4 All Seasons Resort Pool" is exempt from the pool regulation.

section.marginalnote: Commercial pool that is a private residential pool
section.sectiontext: A commercial pool as defined in the pool regulation is exempt from the pool regulation if it is a private residential pool as defined in the pool regulation.

content.regnote: Note: this regulation replaces B.C. Reg. 6/89.
